result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel G. Braun was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 11/5/15 and on the 5th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a   8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

--serve 20 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, this sentence is to be served without electronic monitoring; to commence on 10/12/15 at 8:00am

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

Case called at 2:05pm [mo]
Defendant Daniel G. Braun in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   
DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
recess: 2:12pm--reconvene: 2:49pm [to allow DA Happ to gather information regarding victim rights compliance]

DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

The Court grants the Joint Motion of the Parties, Amending Count #2 to Disorderly Conduct, As a Party to a Crime contrary to sec. 947.01(1) and 939.05 Wis. Stat., a Class B Misdemeanor

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #2 as amended; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Amended Count #2 the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 20 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, this sentence is to be served without electronic monitoring; to commence on 10/12/15 at 8:00am
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 11/5/15 and on the 5th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a   8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

The Court does NOT order a DNA sample since Mr. Daniel Braun has already submitted a sample. 
recess: 3:05pm
State's with Cover Letter
State's proposed verdict form

Cases 15CM177 and 15CM179 called together at 3:07pm [mo]
Co- Defendant Daniel G. Braun in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   
Co- Defendant James R. Braun does NOT appear in court.
Attorney Omar Mallick appears in court
ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CM179(James Braun):
Upon inquiry of the Court, Atty. Mallick indicates that he does have an Authorization to file with the Court
The Court inquires of Counsel, whether Atty. Mallick can appear on behalf of Mr. James Braun when there is an outstanding bench warrant on this case.
The Court cites statute 971.04(2). The Court exercises its discretion and denies Attorney Mallick the ability to appear at this motion hearing on behalf of his client
Atty. Mallick indicates that James Braun's case is scheduled for plea and sentencing and therefore does not take a position on the State's motions
The Court clarifies that the FSSC can be used as the Plea and Sentencing
Upon inquiry of the Clerk, Atty. Mallick indicates that he does not have a different address for James Braun.


As to Case 15CM177 (Daniel Braun): 
Mr. Daniel Braun indicates he is currently residing at the Hilltop Motel in Jefferson

On the State's Notice to Admit Statements:
--the Court finds that all the statements in the State's Notice will be admissible against Daniel Braun at Trial 

On the State's Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions:
--For purposes of Trial Mr. Daniel Braun has 15 prior convictions

On the State's Notice of Convictions for State's Witnesses:
--Rachels=1 prior conviction for purposes of Trial 
--Patten=1 prior conviction for purposes of Trial 
--Lewis=6 prior conviction for purposes of Trial 

The Court and Counsel address Trial procedures:
--The jurors will be allowed to ask questions
--1 day
--Jury Panel will consist of 12 persons
--No alternate

The Court directs Counsel to prepare a verdict form and submit to the Court prior to the scheduled FSSC
recess: 3:40pm
For Defendant, 1)NOH for 10/5/15 FSSC 2)10/8/15 Jury Trial//sent to LKA
NOH for DEF. for 9/17/15 Motion Hearing//sent to LKA
of Convictions for State's Witnesses (with cover letter)
State's (with cover letter)
to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications, State's (with cover letter)
of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant, State's (with cover letter)

Scheduling Order

Case called at 10:36am [mo]
Defendant Daniel G. Braun in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Monica Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Huebner requests a Trial be set, indicates that there is a Co-Defendant and he is not present today.

The Court calls co-defendant's case 15CM179 at 10:38am
Attorney Omar Mallick appears for Co- Defendant James R. Braun

Atty. Mallick indicates that Mr. James Braun is out of town due to a family emergency.
ADA Hall requests a bench warrant for James Braun

Atty. Huebner indicates that the Mr. Daniel Braun is demanding a speedy trial. 
The Court schedules a joint Trial for both cases, 

The Court orders a bench warrant for James Braun.
The Court directs Atty. Mallick to file a motion for severance of the cases, shall James Braun not wish to proceed to trial at the same time as Daniel Braun
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court distributes its scheduling order for both cases, which has been amended by its own hand. 
recess: 10:47am

NEXT: Both Cases: 1)FSSC on 10/5/15 at 2:00pm 2)Jury Trial on 10/8/15 at 8:30am (Case 15CM179 may be a Plea/Sentencing at the FSSC)
Status conference at 09-01-2015 10:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 08-19-2015 11:20 am
Scheduling Notice

[MK] cases #15CM177 and #15CM179 called at 2:05pm. 
Co-Defendant Daniel G. Braun in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  
Co-Defendant James R. Braun in court with Attorney Omar Mallick
ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Huebner enters a plea of "not guilty" on behalf of Daniel Bruan; speedy trial waived by Co-Defendant Daniel Braun
Attorney Mallick enters a plea of "not guilty" on behalf of James Braun; speedy trial waived by Co-Defendant James Braun
The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that then-DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Daniel Braun. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
recess 2:15pm. 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/19/15 at 10:40am (for James Braun) and at 11:20am    (2)  Status Conference on 9/1/15 at 10:30am (for both Co-Defendants)

Cases 15CM177 & 15CM159 called together at 3:28 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Daniel G. Braun in court (15CM177).  Defendant James R. Braun in court (15CM179). ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM177 Court reviews conflict review worksheet as to Daniel Braun; finds no conflict or need to recuse or disqualify and endorses worksheet. 

BOTH CASES: 
Service of Complaint admitted;DOB & address confirmed accurate; charge/penalties recited: reading waived.
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Counts #1 & #2
Mr. Daniel Braun and Mr. James Braun confirm they were present when the Court reviewed right to counsel & constructive waiver of counsel warnings
Both Defendants request counsel

15CM177: Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Absolute sobriety
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-No contact with Randy Patten, Steven Lascari, Brittany Clark, Heather Farnsworth  

15CM179: Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions:
